references.paper_title: 3d u-net: learning dense volumetric segmentation from sparse annotation
references.reason: This paper introduces the 3D U-Net architecture, a foundational model for 3D medical image segmentation that the current paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Unetr: Transformers for 3d medical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces UNETR, a transformer-based model that significantly advanced 3D medical image segmentation, providing a strong benchmark for comparison in the current paper.

references.paper_title: nnu-net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces nnU-Net, a self-adapting framework that sets a new standard for performance across diverse medical image segmentation tasks, providing a crucial point of comparison.

references.paper_title: Inter-slice context residual learning for 3d medical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper addresses the issue of anisotropic data in 3D medical images by proposing a method to improve feature extraction, directly addressing one of the core issues tackled in the current paper.

references.paper_title: 3d ux-net: A large kernel volumetric convnet modernizing hierarchical transformer for medical image segmentation
references.reason: This recent paper proposes 3D UX-Net, which achieves state-of-the-art performance in 3D medical image segmentation, representing the latest advances before the current work.
